properties.Name: InsurableInterestType
properties.Description:
An insurable interest exists when the death of the insured would have a clear financial impact upon the policyholder.

With life insurance an insurable interest must exist only at the time of policy inception.
It does not necessarily have to exist when the policy proceeds are actually paid.

An insurable interest is generally accepted where:

(1)  An individual has an insurable interest in his or her own life

(2)  A husband or wife has an insurable interest in a spouse

(3)  A parent has an insurable interest in his or her child

(4)  A child has an insurable interest in a parent or grandparent

(5)  A business has an insurance interest in the lives of its officers, directors and key employees

(6)  Business partners have an insurable interest in each other

(7)  A credit has an insurable interest in the life of a debtor, but only to the extent of the debt

Columns.Name: InsurableInterestTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Insurable Interest Type.

Columns.Name: InsurableInterestTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of the Insurable Interest Type.

Columns.Name: InsurableInterestTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Insurable Interest Type.

Properties.Description:
An insurable interest exists when the death of the insured would have a clear financial impact upon the policyholder.

With life insurance an insurable interest must exist only at the time of policy inception.
It does not necessarily have to exist when the policy proceeds are actually paid.

An insurable interest is generally accepted where:

(1)  An individual has an insurable interest in his or her own life

(2)  A husband or wife has an insurable interest in a spouse

(3)  A parent has an insurable interest in his or her child

(4)  A child has an insurable interest in a parent or grandparent

(5)  A business has an insurance interest in the lives of its officers, directors and key employees

(6)  Business partners have an insurable interest in each other

(7)  A credit has an insurable interest in the life of a debtor, but only to the extent of the debt
